501(c)(3) nonprofit · Nonpartisan · Public/Private · Washington, D.C. · Ethics-first

Our Mission

Strengthen U.S. national security through trusted collaboration.

♠︎ Empower communities through ethics-first leadership.

♠︎ Advance collaboration across public and private sectors.

♠︎ Convene decision-makers to deliver practical outcomes.

Impact snapshot

Engagements hostedQuarterly series
Fellows placedBi-directional & veterans
PartnersGov · Industry · Academia
Our work takes three forms

Programs that deliver

Speaker series and fellowships that bring the right people into the room—then turn dialogue into deliverables.

Public/Private Engagements

Quarterly Speaker Series

Candid discussions with senior leaders in government, defense, tech, and industry—built for actionable insights, not surface-level commentary.

Best for · Senior leaders, operators, and innovators

  • ♠︎ Curated speakers and closed-door exchange
  • ♠︎ Timely topics tied to mission outcomes
  • ♠︎ Practical takeaways participants can apply
Get more info →

Fellowship

Bi-directional National Security Fellowship

Two-way placement between government and industry professionals to foster trust, share expertise, and align on mission-critical technology and policy.

Best for · Government and industry professionals

  • ♠︎ Immersion in each other’s operating environments
  • ♠︎ Trust-building through hands-on mission work
  • ♠︎ Shared objectives, measurable deliverables
Get more info →

Veterans Fellowship

Department of War National Security Fellowship

A veterans-focused pathway that pairs operational experience with executive leadership to tackle emerging security challenges.

Best for · Veterans and executive leadership teams

  • ♠︎ Mentorship and structured engagement
  • ♠︎ Operational expertise translated into solutions
  • ♠︎ Cross-sector collaboration and resilience
Get more info →
